verse.roman:
pāpe pralambe nihate
devāḥ parama-nirvṛtāḥ
abhyavarṣan balaṁ mālyaiḥ
śaśaṁsuḥ sādhu sādhv iti

synonyms: pāpe—the sinful; pralambe—Pralambāsura; nihate—being killed; devāḥ—the demigods; parama—extremely; nirvṛtāḥ—satisfied; abhyavarṣan—showered; balam—Lord Balarāma; mālyaiḥ—with flower garlands; śaśaṁsuḥ—they offered prayers; sādhu sādhu iti—crying "excellent, excellent."
translation: The sinful Pralamba having been killed, the demigods felt extremely happy, and they showered flower garlands upon Lord Balarāma and praised the excellence of His deed.
